en.question: The Lagrange-like basis polynomial $\chi_w(X_1, ..., X_v)$ is used to construct MLEs. What does $\chi_w$ evaluate to at the point $w$ on the boolean hypercube?
en.feedback: The basis polynomial $\chi_w$ evaluates to $1$ at the point $w$, and to $0$ at all other points on the boolean hypercube. This is exactly analogous to Lagrange basis polynomials in univariate interpolation! The MLE is then constructed as $g(X) = \sum_w f(w) \cdot \chi_w(X)$.
